intro: Leontice tempskyana, commonly known as the mountain leontice, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like parsley and carrots. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are finely divided and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Leontice tempskyana is adapted to harsh alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool, moist climates.
